context: The word 'tulin' is the past tense singular first-person form of the Estonian verb 'tulla', which means 'to come'. It specifically indicates that the speaker has completed the action of coming in the past. In Estonian, verbs are conjugated based on person (I, you, he/she/it, we, you (plural), they) and number (singular/plural). The root form is 'tulla', and 'tulin' is specifically for the first person singular in past tense.
